assumptions: You are arriving in London on April 23rd and departing on April 27th.
You are interested in a mix of historical sites, cultural experiences, and physical activities.
You are able to walk moderate distances.
general_tips: Oyster card or contactless payment is the easiest way to get around on public transport.
Book accommodations and tours in advance, especially during peak season.
Wear comfortable shoes, as you'll be doing a lot of walking.
Tipping is not mandatory in the UK, but it is appreciated for good service (10-15%).
Be aware of your surroundings and keep your belongings safe, especially in crowded areas.

daily_activities.title: Arrival & Arsenal Immersion
daily_activities.daily_tips: Check the Arsenal match schedule in advance. Consider a stadium tour even if there isn't a match.

activities.title: Arrive at Airport & Transfer to Accommodation

daily_activities.title: Historical London & Iranian Influence
daily_activities.daily_tips: Wear comfortable shoes for walking. Brick Lane is best explored during the day.

daily_activities.title: Royal London & Parks
daily_activities.daily_tips: Check the schedule for Changing of the Guard in advance. Pack a picnic for the park.

activities.title: Buckingham Palace & Changing of the Guard
St. James's Park & Green Park Walk

daily_activities.title: Markets, Museums & Physical Challenge
daily_activities.daily_tips: Borough Market can get very crowded on weekends. Choose a walking tour based on your fitness level.

daily_activities.title: Departure
daily_activities.daily_tips: Allow ample time for travel to the airport, especially during rush hour.
